Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are developing a file-based integration to Dynamics 365 Finance.
Microsoft Excel files with 15,000 or more records need to be imported into the system periodically by individual users. The records need to be imported in full within a 5-minute approved window.
You need to determine how to accomplish the import into the system.
Solution: Import the data by using the recurring data integrations API.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: Correct. Because you need to use the Refresh entity list option.

The answer YES is correct.

This is a PERIODIC task of importing values from excel file containing 15000 records.

Workflow
Change the owner for every record in the package data to Admin, unless the users in the workflow are already imported.

GL Shared 
Account structures active group 
This composite entity will export and import only the active account structures. If you use any other account structure entities, the status of the active account structures will be changed to Draft, and you must activate them before they can be used.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company is deploying a second instance of Dynamics 365 Finance.
You export configuration and setup data from the existing instance. You observe the following issues:
✑ When you export the account structures from the existing instance, only two of five account structures export.
✑ When you import the workflow entity into the new instance, an error occurs.
You need to fix the export and import issues.
How should you fix the issues? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are developing a file-based integration to Dynamics 365 Finance.
Microsoft Excel files with 15,000 or more records need to be imported into the system periodically by individual users. The records need to be imported in full within a 5-minute approved window.
You need to determine how to accomplish the import into the system.
Solution: Import the data by using the Data Management Framework's package API.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct!
The correct answer is A. Yes.

A. Yes. This is a correct answer because importing the data by using the Data Management Framework's package API is a feature that allows you to import data from Excel files or other sources into Dynamics 365 Finance by using a RESTful service. You can use this feature to import large volumes of data in a fast and reliable way. You can also monitor the status and progress of the data import.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/integration-overview.
When it's a "file" to import, it can only be Data Integrations API
One has to refresh Data entity from System administration > Data management > Settings > ***Refresh data entity
Correct. Because you need to use the Refresh entity list option.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator. You have a test environment that is used by several people at any given time.
You create a new data entity in your development environment and migrate the code to the test environment. In the test environment, you are unable to find the data entity in the list.
You need to locate the data entity.
Solution: Reopen the client browser.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: System administration > Workspaces >Data management>framework parameters>Entity Settings>Refresh Entity List.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator. You have a test environment that is used by several people at any given time.
You create a new data entity in your development environment and migrate the code to the test environment. In the test environment, you are unable to find the data entity in the list.
You need to locate the data entity.
Solution: In the Data management framework parameter screen, refresh the Entity list.
Does the solution meet the goal?
